intro: Molyza moly, commonly known as the common moly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy aroma. Molyza moly is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
